name: List of Tournaments
summary: US Club Soccer members can browse this list of our sanctioned tournaments, organized by month.

name: Safeguarding & Compliance
summary: Participant Health & Safety/Risk Management This page aggregates a variety of information and resources related to Participant Health & Safety/Risk Management, one the pillars of US Club Soccer’s Players First philosophy. Please reference this Member Update, released in January 2023, for Read More »

name: Registration
summary: Please review the tabs for the key dates and important information.

name: About
summary: A National Association member of the U.S. Soccer Federation, US Club Soccer is a non-profit organization committed to the development and support of soccer clubs in the United States. Among US Club Soccer’s guiding principles: Clubs are the vehicle through which Read More »

name: Vision, Mission & Values
summary: US Club Soccer will be the finest soccer organization in America and an integral part of U.S. National Team success.

name: FAQs
summary: Below are answers to questions prospective members often have. You should also note the other information on the website.

name: Partners
city: held insurance agency nationally with its headquarters office in the Orlando suburb of Longwood
summary: US Club Soccer Partners and Supporting Partners

name: Board of Directors
summary: Regional Board Directors are elected by a popular vote of competitive member clubs in good standing in each region. Each member club has one vote for each Board of Directors seat vacancy in its region. At-Large Directors are appointed by the US Club Soccer Board of Directors.

name: Staff Directory
summary: Meet the US Club Soccer staff! Find their contact information and learn more about our team members here.

name: Employment / Internships
summary: We're Hiring!

name: Programs
summary: PLAYERS FIRST Players First is a philosophy that guides US Club Soccer, its leadership, and member clubs and leagues to establish the optimal environment for player development and member experiences. Players First was founded on the following pillars: Club Development Read More »

name: Leagues
summary: US Club Soccer administers and sanctions leagues throughout the country for various age groups, competitive levels and geographic sizes and areas. These league platforms are all created with similar principles and guidelines, and collectively provide a full competition spectrum for modern clubs

name: NPL Finals - US Club Soccer Website
summary: The NPL Finals is the annual, coveted destination for all NPL participants. U-13 through U-19 teams qualify through year-long competition within their respective member leagues.

name: ECNL
summary: US Club Soccer is proud to sanction the Elite Clubs National League (ECNL) as a top, league-based platform for both girls and boys players.

name: Recreation & Community
summary: REC AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS US Club Soccer offers recreational (“rec”) membership to youth clubs, leagues or programs that are primarily in-house or intramural in nature. Rec programs may be part of an existing (competitive) club, or they may be an Read More »

name: U-23 and Adult
summary: In US Club Soccer, you can be a member for life — maintaining membership as a youth player to an adult. US Club Soccer sanctions adult leagues and competitions and offers adult registration for its members. For this purpose, adult Read More »

name: Sanction Your League
summary: NEW APPLICANTS To apply to sanction your league or rec program with US Club Soccer, please submit the following documents via email to your applicable General Manager. A completed and signed US Club Soccer league/rec program sanctioning application Bylaws/policies Disciplinary rules/procedures Read More »

name: National Cup Finals - US Club Soccer Website
summary: The National Cup Finals is the culmination of qualifying from National Cup Regionals and state cups held all over the country. In 2026, the National Cup – US Club Soccer’s longest standing competition – will celebrate its 25th edition. VENUE Read More »

name: National Cup Finals champions archive / Doug Hamilton Memorial Trophy
summary: Doug Hamilton Memorial Cup Doug Hamilton, the former president and general manager of the LA Galaxy, was well known for his impact in the sport. When he passed away in 2006, US Club Soccer named its National Cup Finals trophy Read More »

name: State Championships
summary: US Club Soccer’s state championship competitions allow clubs to develop a format as they see best in their respective state, which may include multiple competition levels, a home-and-home series, team seeding, as well as flexible schedule and roster rules.

name: Sanctioned Tournaments
city: the National Cup and state championship events
summary: In addition to operating competitions, such as NPL events, the National Cup and state championship events, US Club Soccer also sanctions tournaments for its members.

name: Attending a Tournament
summary: US CLUB SOCCER MEMBERS ATTENDING A NON-US CLUB SOCCER-SANCTIONED TOURNAMENT: US Club Soccer member teams are free to travel to any “open/unrestricted” tournament (as nearly all are) sanctioned by a U.S. Soccer Federation affiliate member. Most tournaments are “unrestricted,” which Read More »

name: Sanction a Tournament
summary: APPLY FOR US CLUB SOCCER SANCTIONING TOURNAMENT SANCTIONING: General Information: All tournament applications must be submitted by a US Club Soccer member club no later than 60 days prior to the start of the tournament.  All tournaments must comply with Read More »

name: Player Identification
summary: US Club Soccer offers a pair of integrated player identification and development platforms, both of which are Olympic Development Programs by the U.S. Soccer Federation and U.S. Olympic Committee.

name: id2 Program
summary: Established in 2004, US Club Soccer’s id2 National Identification and Development Program provides an opportunity for the country’s elite youth soccer players to be identified and developed, and scouted for inclusion in U.S. Soccer’s National Team programs. id2 Program directors Gerry McKeown (boys) and Tricia Taliaferro (girls) implement curriculum and direct activities.

name: The Process
summary: Targeted birth years are established every year in consultation with U.S. Soccer in order to align with the scouting priorities for the U-14 National Teams. The steps below outline the process once targeted birth years are established.

name: Recommend a Player
summary: Any club’s Director of Coaching is able to recommend players with national team potential for inclusion at an id2 Training Camp.

name: Events
summary: Take a look at our past and current events with our id2 events!

name: Player Development Program
summary: US Club Soccer’s Player Development Programs (PDPs) are regionally based identification and developmental programs conducted within the id2 Program umbrella. PDPs are focused around the National Premier Leagues (NPL) and other top leagues in specific geographic areas.

name: Education
summary: US Club Soccer believes educational resources should be accessible, affordable and inclusive in the soccer community.

name: Players First
summary: Players First is a branded, holistic club soccer experience for parents and players, which emphasizes the development of each individual to his or her full potential, and helps parents make better choices about where their children should play.

name: Coach Education
summary: The mission of US Club Soccer's coach education efforts is to provide its members with accessible, affordable and relevant educational opportunities and resources through inclusive programming that supports the holistic development of our players, coaches and clubs.

name: U.S. Soccer Education
city: Regardless of where you are in your coaching journey
summary: US Club Soccer facilitates opportunities to meet the various levels and goals of coaches throughout the country.

name: Courses
summary: For all courses, click on the “Learn More” button on the back of each flip box below, which will direct you to U.S. Soccer’s Learning Center to view courses in your area hosted by US Club Soccer and its member organizations. Once in the Learning Center, filter the “Host” category by selecting US Club Soccer.

name: Coach Educators
summary: US Club Soccer has more than 100 coach educators who deliver about 300 U.S. Soccer licenses annually. Our team teaches a variety of courses on the Coaching Licensing Pathway, including the Grassroots, ‘D,’ ‘C,’ and ‘B’ licenses, as well as supplemental courses, such as the Director of Coaching license.

name: Innovate to Grow
summary: US Club Soccer launched its Innovate to Grow program, Coach Education for Current & Former Players, in collaboration with NorCal Premier Soccer and SOCAL Soccer League. The program will include a fully funded U.S. Soccer grassroots coach licensing pathway to ignite a passion for coaching to current players and former players who are new to coaching aged 18-30.

name: Mental Health
summary: US Club Soccer provides resources for its members to improve their mental health. Stop the stigma; keep the conversation around mental health ongoing.

name: Inclusivity
summary: Fostering inclusive environments for families, athletes, parents, coaches, administrators and referees is critical to growing youth soccer.

name: Sideline Behavior
summary: Appropriate sideline behavior is critical for the support and development of our players, coaches and referees.

name: Referee Support
summary: US Club Soccer recognizes the critical need to recruit and develop referees, and encourages its members to foster a supporting environment for referees to participate and grow.

summary: Bylaws, Policies, and Guidelines relating to FIFA and U.S. Soccer, U.S. Club Soccer, and its logo usage.

name: Insurance
summary: As a benefit to membership, accident and liability insurance coverage is provided to members while participating in US Club Soccer-operated and -sanctioned Covered Activities

name: Youth Summary (2025-26)
summary: OVERVIEW US Club Soccer provides excess participant accident medical and liability insurance coverage for Covered Activities via the Insurance Office of America, Inc. (IOA) as a benefit of membership, as further summarized below. This information covers the insurance coverage policy Read More »

name: Youth Summary (2024-25)
summary: As a benefit of membership, soccer players, coaches, officials and other registered members receive excess participant accident medical and liability insurance coverage for their Covered Activities of US Club Soccer via the Insurance Office of America, Inc. (IOA).

name: Youth Summary (2023-24)
summary: As a benefit of membership, soccer players, coaches, officials and other registered members receive excess participant accident medical and liability insurance coverage for their Covered Activities of US Club Soccer via the Insurance Office of America, Inc. (IOA).

name: Certificates of Insurance (COIs)
summary: To request a certificate of liability insurance (COI) for a US Club Soccer member organization or a field/facility owner a member organization is using for US Club Soccer-sanctioned programming

name: Accident Claims
summary: US Club Soccer provides accident medical-dental insurance coverage to its registered members participating in US Club Soccer-sanctioned and -authorized activities.

name: Join US Club Soccer
summary: This page provides information about the categories of US Club Soccer membership as well as instructions on how to join.

name: Staff Registration
summary: US Club Soccer staff registration is required of any non-player Direct Adult Participant (DAP) who has Regular Contact with or authority over Minor Athletes in activities within US Club Soccer’s jurisdiction.

name: Player Registration
summary: Registration is required of all players participating in US Club Soccer-operated or -sanctioned programming. Players who are not currently registered with US Club Soccer are not allowed to participate in US Club Soccer programming, nor are they covered by US Club Soccer insurance.

city: Please note that pursuant to federal law

name: Background Screening
summary: Pursuant to US Club Soccer Policy 13.08, background screening (and disqualification-suspension review) is required of all Adult Participants

name: For Parents and Players
summary: The U.S. Center for SafeSport’s FREE Online Parent Toolkits give you the necessary SafeSport information for your young athlete. Separated by age group or combined for all ages, these Toolkits help parents understand SafeSport best practices and how to respond to signs of abuse.

name: Goal Safety
summary: GOAL SAFETY US Club Soccer expects its members to ensure safe training and competition environments. This includes the installation, use and storage of all movable soccer goals. US Club Soccer recognizes the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission’s Guidelines for Movable Soccer Read More »

name: Head Injuries
summary: U.S. Soccer announced the U.S. Soccer Concussion Initiative, which provides guidelines that were implemented beginning in January 2016. US Club Soccer clarified the following implementation guidelines as it relates to concussion initiatives and heading for youth players

name: Legislation

name: Policy Statement and Definitions
summary: US Club Soccer has zero tolerance for abuse or misconduct. US Club Soccer is committed to providing a safe environment and preventing abusive conduct in any form.

name: Prevention Policies: 1-on-1
city: one interaction between Minor Athletes and Adult Participants may be conducive to improving physical skills
summary: This page contains US Club Soccer’s Prevention Policies as they appear in Policy 13.06. It is part of US Club Soccer’s Participant Safety/Risk Management Policies.

name: Prohibited Conduct
summary: This page contains US Club Soccer’s Prohibited Conduct Policy as it appears in Appendix A of US Club Soccer’s Policy Manual. It was updated December 15, 2021 to be effective January 1, 2022, and is part of US Club Soccer’s Participant Safety/Risk Management Policies.

name: SafeSport
summary: This page aggregates information and resources from other pages regarding the Protecting Young Victims from Sexual Abuse and Safe Sport Authorization Act of 2017 (the “SafeSport Act”)
